content:
WorkflowApplicationCompletedEventArgs Class

In this Article

Provides information about a workflow instance that has completed its execution.

Syntax

Declaration

public class WorkflowApplicationCompletedEventArgs : System.Activities.WorkflowApplicationEventArgs

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • EventArgs
  • System.Activities.WorkflowApplicationEventArgs
  • WorkflowApplicationCompletedEventArgs

Inherited Members

,

,
Empty
,

,

,

,

MemberwiseClone()
,
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
,
ToString()

Properties summary

CompletionState

Gets the completion state of the workflow instance, which indicates whether the workflow instance completed successfully, was canceled, or faulted.
Outputs

Gets a dictionary that contains the values of OutArguments of the workflow instanceâ€™s root activity, keyed by argument name.
TerminationException

Gets the exception associated with the termination of the workflow instance.

Properties

  • CompletionState

    Gets the completion state of the workflow instance, which indicates whether the workflow instance completed successfully, was canceled, or faulted.

    public System.Activities.ActivityInstanceState CompletionState { get; }

    Property Value

    • ActivityInstanceState

      The completion state of the workflow instance, which indicates whether the workflow instance completed successfully, was canceled, or faulted.

    Example

    The following code example inspects the WorkflowApplicationCompletedEventArgs passed into the Completed handler of a WorkflowApplication instance and displays information about how the workflow completed. 

                wfApp.Completed = delegate(WorkflowApplicationCompletedEventArgs e)
            {
                if (e.CompletionState == ActivityInstanceState.Faulted)
                {
                    Console.WriteLine("Workflow {0} Terminated.", e.InstanceId);
                    Console.WriteLine("Exception: {0}
    {1}",
                        e.TerminationException.GetType().FullName,
                        e.TerminationException.Message);
                }
                else if (e.CompletionState == ActivityInstanceState.Canceled)
                {
                    Console.WriteLine("Workflow {0} Canceled.", e.InstanceId);
                }
                else
                {
                    Console.WriteLine("Workflow {0} Completed.", e.InstanceId);

                    // Retrieve the outputs of the workflow.
                    foreach (var kvp in e.Outputs)
                    {
                        Console.WriteLine("Name: {0} - Value {1}",
                            kvp.Key, kvp.Value);
                    }

                    // Outputs can be directly accessed by argument name.
                    Console.WriteLine("The winner is {0}.", e.Outputs["Winner"]);
                }
            };
  • Outputs

    Gets a dictionary that contains the values of OutArguments of the workflow instanceâ€™s root activity, keyed by argument name.

    public System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary<string,object> Outputs { get; }

    Property Value

    • IDictionary<String,Object>

      A dictionary that contains the values of OutArguments of the workflow instanceâ€™s root activity, keyed by argument name.

    Example

    The following code example inspects the WorkflowApplicationCompletedEventArgs passed into the Completed handler of a WorkflowApplication instance and displays information about how the workflow completed. 

                wfApp.Completed = delegate(WorkflowApplicationCompletedEventArgs e)
            {
                if (e.CompletionState == ActivityInstanceState.Faulted)
                {
                    Console.WriteLine("Workflow {0} Terminated.", e.InstanceId);
                    Console.WriteLine("Exception: {0}
    {1}",
                        e.TerminationException.GetType().FullName,
                        e.TerminationException.Message);
                }
                else if (e.CompletionState == ActivityInstanceState.Canceled)
                {
                    Console.WriteLine("Workflow {0} Canceled.", e.InstanceId);
                }
                else
                {
                    Console.WriteLine("Workflow {0} Completed.", e.InstanceId);

                    // Retrieve the outputs of the workflow.
                    foreach (var kvp in e.Outputs)
                    {
                        Console.WriteLine("Name: {0} - Value {1}",
                            kvp.Key, kvp.Value);
                    }

                    // Outputs can be directly accessed by argument name.
                    Console.WriteLine("The winner is {0}.", e.Outputs["Winner"]);
                }
            };
  • TerminationException

    Gets the exception associated with the termination of the workflow instance.

    public Exception TerminationException { get; }

    Property Value

    • Exception

      The exception associated with the termination of the workflow instance.

    Example

    The following code example inspects the WorkflowApplicationCompletedEventArgs passed into the Completed handler of a WorkflowApplication instance and displays information about how the workflow completed. 

                wfApp.Completed = delegate(WorkflowApplicationCompletedEventArgs e)
            {
                if (e.CompletionState == ActivityInstanceState.Faulted)
                {
                    Console.WriteLine("Workflow {0} Terminated.", e.InstanceId);
                    Console.WriteLine("Exception: {0}
    {1}",
                        e.TerminationException.GetType().FullName,
                        e.TerminationException.Message);
                }
                else if (e.CompletionState == ActivityInstanceState.Canceled)
                {
                    Console.WriteLine("Workflow {0} Canceled.", e.InstanceId);
                }
                else
                {
                    Console.WriteLine("Workflow {0} Completed.", e.InstanceId);

                    // Retrieve the outputs of the workflow.
                    foreach (var kvp in e.Outputs)
                    {
                        Console.WriteLine("Name: {0} - Value {1}",
                            kvp.Key, kvp.Value);
                    }

                    // Outputs can be directly accessed by argument name.
                    Console.WriteLine("The winner is {0}.", e.Outputs["Winner"]);
                }
            };
